articles.title: Princess Catherine and Charlotte Play Piano Together for Christmas
articles.summary: Princess Catherine and her daughter Princess Charlotte played a piano duet for a Christmas carol concert. They did not perform live at the event in Westminster Abbey but recorded their music at Windsor Castle. The video was shown on TV on Christmas Eve. In the clip, they sat together at the piano, with Catherine using her left hand and Charlotte using her right hand. Catherine talked about how Christmas is about love in simple ways like listening and helping others. This is not the first time Catherine has played piano at a carol service. The concert was about celebrating love and togetherness, and Catherine wanted to show how important connections are.

articles.title: A Rock Band Guitarist Passes Away
articles.summary: Mick Abrahams, who helped start the rock band Jethro Tull, has died at 82 years old. He was a singer and guitarist in the band. Ian Anderson, the lead singer, shared this sad news on the band's website. He said Mick was very important when the band began and had great musical skills. Mick played on the band's first album but left soon after to form another band called Blodwyn Pig. Later, he had a solo career but stopped performing after a stroke. Ian described Mick as someone who liked to stay close to home and perform locally. The band sends their love to Mick's family and friends, saying they should be proud of his music.

articles.title: A Very Busy Christmas Eve for Travel in the UK
articles.summary: This article talks about how Christmas Eve in the UK is going to be super busy for travel. The Civil Aviation Authority says more people than ever before will fly on this day, with over 335,000 passengers expected at airports. That's 5% more than last year. Roads will also be very crowded, especially from 1pm to 7pm, as many people drive home for Christmas. Airports like Manchester and Heathrow are preparing for lots of flights and passengers. Some trains won't run on Christmas Day, so more people might drive, making roads even busier. Experts say this could be the busiest travel time since records started.

articles.title: A Grandma Who Played Games Online
articles.summary: Agnes was a 78-year-old grandma from Dunfermline who became famous on TikTok, where she was called EpicGamerGrandma. She had millions of followers who loved watching her play games, use soundboards, and try fun filters. Sadly, she died in the hospital after having a stroke. Her grandson Dylan shared that she was a kind person who always put her family first, even before she was online. Agnes also talked about her health problems, like COPD, which made her cough, and she shared her feelings after her husband passed away. Her story shows that you can have fun and connect with people at any age, and she inspired many young fans around the world.

articles.title: BP Sells Part of Castrol for $6 Billion
articles.summary: BP, a big oil company, sold a 65% stake in Castrol, its motor oil division, for $6 billion to Stonepeak, an investment firm from the US. Castrol makes lubricants for cars and other vehicles. BP will keep 35% of Castrol. The money from the sale will help BP pay off debts and focus on its main oil and gas business. BP is selling many assets to reach a $20 billion goal, and this deal helps them get halfway there. They are also changing their strategy to invest more in oil and gas instead of green energy. This sale happened after BP announced its first female CEO, Meg O'Neill, who will start in 2026. The deal is part of BP's plan to simplify its business and improve its finances.

articles.title: Winnie-the-Pooh's 100-Year Forest Adventure
articles.summary: Winnie-the-Pooh is a famous bear from stories that started 100 years ago. The stories were written by AA Milne and are about his son Christopher Robin and a toy bear. They have adventures in a forest called Ashdown Forest in England. People all over the world love Pooh and his friends like Tigger. The forest is still popular today, and many visitors come to see places from the stories, like Pooh Sticks Bridge. The area uses money to celebrate Pooh's anniversary with fun events. A shop called Pooh Corner sells gifts and has tea for fans. Pooh became even more famous when Disney made movies about him. The stories bring joy and help the local community.
